## 657. STICK
### Definition
Most generic term for a long, thin piece of wood, mainly left in the shape in which it grew, that does not bend. (Concepticon) Avoid terms specifically used for starting a fire. Avoid terms for smaller sticks, e.g. "twigs". (CoBL) Also avoid terms for specific functional types of sticks, such as ‘staff’, etc.

### Contexts
1. He hit the dog with a stick. 2. He picked up a stick from the ground.
